Text:
...We've identified a facility on the outskirts of
the Velgalta Empire that is suspected to be a
hideout for the Cult.

The Cult has been gathering special boxes used for
transporting artifacts from various locations and
bringing them to this hideout.
What's inside these boxes?
It's unknown.

How is that possible? Did you not conduct an
investigation?!
...My apologies.
Why the rush?
It's nothingâ€”

If we stole the boxes to investigate them and
alerted the Cult, we might end up jeopardizing
our lead, right?

That's why we let them be until we located the
hideout. Now that we've found it, we can destroy it
and confiscate the boxes... It's as simple as that.
Mnhh...!

No. 122 is right. Besides, the transport of these
boxes is heavily guarded, making it practically
impossible to confirm their contents.

What we do know is that these boxes are specially
made to preserve the magic of the artifacts
contained within.

And these items, which necessitate such high levels
of protection, are consistently being transported to
the hideout as part of the Cult's supplies.

...No.111. I understand your eagerness to settle
things with Sergey.

However, the Shadow Garden's actions are not driven
by your desire for revenge or the personal whims of
any member.

We act with a far greater purpose in mind.
Never forget that.
Understood...!
We'll wait for nightfall to strike.

Make sure to prepare for any unforeseen
circumstances that may arise beyond a
typical raid...understood?
Got it!
...Hey, Beta.
Yes?
What's your take on No.111's current condition?
You're worried about No.111, not No.122?

Yes... No.122 claims to be detached, but in reality,
she's the type who gets the job done without
distractions.

True, No.111's emotional outbursts are a more
significant concern than No.122's seeming
indifference.
...This is just my impression, but...

Despite No.111's strong desire for revenge against
Sergey, she seems to have no vision for the futureâ€”
what will happen after Sergey is defeated?
You see it that way too, Beta?
Yes. In fact, it's quite obvious.

Her response to the mission earlier was a clear
sign. She noticeably lost her enthusiasm as soon as
she realized it wasn't directly related to Sergey.

...She could still be struggling to determine what
she's fighting for.

Most likely, but there's not much we can do about
that.

Each of us in the Garden took up the sword for our
own reasons. Even having "no reason," like No.122,
is a valid answer.
So, all we can do is just watch...
Epsilon. Being overprotective isn't the solution.
Me?! Overprotective?! Of No.111?!

Not just No.111, but all your subordinates in the
Garden.
What...?! Th-That's not what I meant...!

They'll learn through grappling with their concerns
and facing their battles independently.
Well, that may have been how it was for you, but...!

If someone is attempting to be self-reliant, there
are times when it's best to restrain our urge to
assist and simply watch over them.
Just as Master Shadow and Lady Alpha do for us.

True, Master Shadow and Lady Alpha usually just
watch over me when they think I can handle things
on my own...!

So, let's stand strong for our subordinates and be
prepared to extend a helping hand when it's truly
necessary.
Beta...!

...Y-You...! When did you develop a big heart, and
not just big breasts...?!
Huh? Big what...?!

Nothing! I'm just agreeing with your perspective!
That's all!
R-Right...
